intro: Summerhayesia rwandensis, commonly known as the Rwandan summerhayesia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Rwanda. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at elevations above 2,000 meters. It is noted for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential ecological role in its native environment. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
